conclusion: Determine which light will first undergo total internal reflection by considering the critical angle for each light.
The critical angle is the angle of incidence above which total internal reflection occurs, given by θ_c = sin^(-1)(n_2/n_1).
n_1 is the refractive index of the medium from which the light is coming (glass), and n_2 is the refractive index of the medium into which the light is going (air).
Since the refractive index of air is approximately 1, the critical angle simplifies to θ_c = sin^(-1)(1/n_1).
For total internal reflection to occur, the angle of incidence must be greater than the critical angle.
The light with the smaller critical angle will undergo total internal reflection first.
Given that the prism is equilateral, the angle of incidence for both lights is the same when they enter the glass.
